name: aocc

conflicts.name: ~license-agreed
conflicts.description: Installation of aocc requires acceptance of the EULA (found at https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocc/aocc-compiler/eula.html). Set the +license-agreed variant to confirm acceptance of the EULA

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
The AOCC compiler system is a high performance, production quality code
generation tool. The AOCC environment provides various options to
developers when building and optimizing C, C++, and Fortran applications
targeting 32-bit and 64-bit Linux platforms. The AOCC compiler system
offers a high level of advanced optimizations, multi-threading and
processor support that includes global optimization, vectorization,
inter-procedural analyses, loop transformations, and code generation.
AMD also provides highly optimized libraries, which extract the optimal
performance from each x86 processor core when utilized. The AOCC
Compiler Suite simplifies and accelerates development and tuning for x86
applications. Installation requires acceptance of the EULA by setting
the +license-agreed variant. https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocc/aocc-
compiler/eula.html Example for installation: 'spack install aocc
+license-agreed'

dependencies.name: libxml2
dependencies.description:
Libxml2 is the XML C parser and toolkit developed for the Gnome project
(but usable outside of the Gnome platform), it is free software
available under the MIT License.

dependencies.name: zlib
dependencies.description:
A free, general-purpose, legally unencumbered lossless data-compression
library.

dependencies.name: ncurses
dependencies.description:
The ncurses (new curses) library is a free software emulation of curses
in System V Release 4.0, and more. It uses terminfo format, supports
pads and color and multiple highlights and forms characters and
function-key mapping, and has all the other SYSV-curses enhancements
over BSD curses.

dependencies.name: libtool
dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.

dependencies.name: texinfo
dependencies.description:
Texinfo is the official documentation format of the GNU project. It was
invented by Richard Stallman and Bob Chassell many years ago, loosely
based on Brian Reid's Scribe and other formatting languages of the time.
It is used by many non-GNU projects as well.
